Package aima.gui.swing.framework

This package provides useful base classes for building graphical agent applications based on Swing. The design is inspired by the model-view-controller pattern. An Environment serves as model, the AgentAppFrame together with its embedded AgentAppEnvironmentView as view, and the AgentAppController as controller. The SimpleAgentApp application demonstrates, how this parts can be plugged together.
  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    MessageLogger
    Simple interface for message logging.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AgentAppController
    Provides the base class for all controller implementations.
    AgentAppEnvironmentView
    Base class for all graphical environment view implementations.
    AgentAppFrame
    Universal frame for building graphical agent applications.
    AgentAppFrame.SelectionState
    Contains the names of all selectors and the indices of their selected items.
    DemoController
    Simple controller implementation which shows the relationship between buttons and selector activations and controller method calls.
    EmptyEnvironmentView
    Simple graphical environment view without content but with some useful transformation features.
    MessageLoggerPanel
    Implements a simple text panel for message display.
    PopupShower
    Useful helper class for showing popup menus.
    SimpleAgentApp
    In this framework a graphical agent application consists at least of three parts: An AgentAppEnvironmentView, an AgentAppFrame, and an AgentAppController.
    SimulationThread
    Background thread, which is used for simulation.
